availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse Mattingly (Clay County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Asher Mattingly in Clay County, Kentucky on February 1, 1855. Father of Joseph Mattingly, Nancy Mattingly, Moses G. Mattingly, John Mattingly, Sally Mattingly, and Jimimy Mattingly. Farmer in Clay County, Kentucky in 1860. Employed Elizabeth Amet as a servant in Clay County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 118A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 61.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Precinct 5, p. 206A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clay County Marriages, Film #001904623, p.
